  1. # vim: set fileencoding=utf-8 :
  2. """
  3. Authentication backends for checking permissions
  5. Method:
  6. get_permission_handler
  7. get permission handler of the model from registry
  9. Class:
  10. PermissionBackend
  11. Authentication backend for checking permissions

  40. """
  41. from __future__ import with_statement
  43. from permission.handlers import registry
  45. __all__ = ('PermissionBackend',)
  48. class PermissionBackend(object):
  49. """Authentication backend for cheking permissions
  51. This backend is used to check permissions. The permissions
  52. are handled with ``PermissionHandler`` which have to be registered in
  53. ``fluidpermission.handlers.registry`` before use.
  55. ``has_perm(user_obj, perm, obj=None)`` method of detected model's
  56. ``PermissionHandler`` will be used to cheking process.
  58. If no model was detected or no handler was registered, this backend
  59. does not touch that permission and return ``None`` to pass the permission
  60. checking process to downstream backends.
  62. """
  63. supports_object_permissions = True
  64. supports_anonymous_user = True
  65. supports_inactive_user = True
  67. def authenticate(self, username, password):
  68. """This backend is only for checking permission"""
  69. return None
  71. def has_perm(self, user_obj, perm, obj=None):
  72. """check permission"""
  73. # get permission handlers fot this perm
  74. handlers = registry.get_handlers(perm)
  75. for handler in handlers:
  76. if handler.has_perm(user_obj, perm, obj=obj):
  77. return True
  78. # do not touch this permission
  79. return False
  81. def has_module_perms(self, user_obj, app_label):
  82. # get permission handlers fot this perm
  83. handlers = registry.get_module_handlers(app_label)
  84. for handler in handlers:
  85. if handler.has_module_perms(user_obj, app_label):
  86. return True
  87. return False
